AdditiveStatusEnumeration.description: Actual status of the additive provides a minimal error handling for devices without event support.

GOOD.description: Component has no error or warning.

WARNING.description: The component has an undefined warning, but no need to stop the production.

ADVANCE_WARNING_ADDITIVE_CHANGE.description: Warning, additive change is imminent. No need to stop the process.

ERROR_EMPTY.description: Error, the additive is empty. Production needs to be stopped.

ERROR.description: The additive has an error and process needs to be stopped.

ActivateAdditive.description: Set value to activate the additive

ActivateClosedLoopControl.description: Activate the closed loop control of the additive

AdditiveActivated.description: Is true if the additive is activated.

ClosedLoopControlActivated.description: Is true if the closed loop control of the additive is activated

IsPresent.description: Informs the client if the additive is physically present.

Status.title: AdditiveStatusEnumeration
Status.description: Actual status of the additive provides a minimal error handling for devices without event support.

AdditivesPressure.description: Average pressure of the additive during the last cycle at the measuring point

AdditivesRatioActual.description: Actual ratios of additive in percentage

AdditivesRatioTarget.description: Target ratios of additives in percentage which are set in AdditiveFraction of AdditiveType

FilterPressurePrimary.description: Average material pressure during the last cycle before the filter

FilterPressureSecondary.description: Average material pressure during the last cycle after the filter

MixingPointPressureA.description: Average pressure of component A during the last cycle at the blender

MixingPointPressureB.description: Average pressure of component B during the last cycle at the blender

MixingPointPressureBlender.description: Average pressure of components A and B during the last cycle at the blender

MixingRatioActual.description: Actual mixing ratio of the components

MixingRatioTarget.description: Target mixing ratio of the last cycle (includes ratio change when MaterialBalanceSystem is active)

ResidualAmountA.description: Residual weight amount of component A at the end of the dosing cycle

ResidualAmountB.description: Residual weight amount of component B at the end of the dosing cycle

VolumeA.description: Volume of component A that was added to the process in the last cycle

VolumeAB.description: Volume of components A + B that was added to the process in the last cycle

VolumeAdditives.description: Volumes of the additives that were added to the process in the last cycle

VolumeB.description: Volume of component B that was added to the process in the last cycle

VolumeTotal.description: Volume of all components (A + B + all additives)

data.description: Average pressure of the additive during the last cycle at the measuring point
Actual ratios of additive in percentage
Target ratios of additives in percentage which are set in AdditiveFraction of AdditiveType

Average material pressure during the last cycle after the filter

Average pressure of component B during the last cycle at the blender
Average pressure of components A and B during the last cycle at the blender
Actual mixing ratio of the components
Target mixing ratio of the last cycle (includes ratio change when MaterialBalanceSystem is active)
Residual weight amount of component A at the end of the dosing cycle
Residual weight amount of component B at the end of the dosing cycle
Volume of component A that was added to the process in the last cycle
Volume of components A + B that was added to the process in the last cycle

Volume of component B that was added to the process in the last cycle
Volume of all components (A + B + all additives)

ComponentStatusEnumeration.description: Actual status of the component provides a minimal error handling for devices without event support.

GOOD.description: Component has no error or warning.

WARNING.description: The component has an undefined warning, but no need to stop the production.

WARNING_PRESSURE_TOO_HIGH.description: Pressure is too high. No need to stop the process but influence to the part quality.

WARNING_PRESSURE_TOO_LOW.description: Pressure is too low. No need to stop the process but influence to the part quality.

ADVANCE_WARNING_DRUM_CHANGE.description: Warning, barrel change is imminent. No need to stop the process.

ERROR_DRUM_EMPTY.description: Drum of the component is empty. Production needs to be stopped.

ERROR.description: The component has an error and process needs to be stopped.

SetSetValueDensity.description: This optional method is used to modify SetValueDensity if allowed by the device.

ActualFollowerPlatePressure.description: Actual material pressure under the follower plate

AllowsCycles.description: Expected number of remaining cycles with the current drum

RemainingMaterialTime.description: Time until the material of the component is empty

SetFollowerPlatePressure.description: Set value for material pressure under the follower plate

Status.title: ComponentStatusEnumeration
Status.description: Actual status of the component provides a minimal error handling for devices without event support.

data.description: Actual material pressure under the follower plate
Actual pressure of the component
Maximum capacity of the drum
Time until the material of the component is empty
Residual amount of the material
Set value for material pressure under the follower plate
Set point material density

DeviceEnabled.description: This variable is used to release the drives of the dosing system. If the value is FALSE, the LDS shall not be able to start ist drives.

DisplayLanguage.description: With this Property the client can set the desired language on the user interface at the LDS

IdentifyDevice.description: The peripheral device on which this method is called shows itself by e.g. activation of a LED.

ResetAllErrors.description: Method to reset all errors of the device

ResetErrorById.description: Method to reset one error of the device

SetCycleNumber.description: Method to set the cycle number of the LDS to synchronize it with the cycle number of the injection moulding machine

StartDosing.description: If RemoteControlActivated = 2, this Method (without arguments) is used to start the dosing

ActivateMaterialBalanceSystem.description: If the value is true, the material balance system is activated

ActivateRemoteControl.description: With this variable the client selects the method of remote control

ActiveErrors.description: List of the active errors of the device

items.title: ClassifiedActiveErrorDataType
items.description: Iinformation about an active error in a device including the SoureNodes and a Classification

SourceNodes.description: NodeIds of the Nodes which cause the error

Classification.description: Classification of the error, if a process parameter expressed as MonitoredParameterType is the cause of the error

ActualDeviationMixingRatio.description: Actual deviation of the mixing ratio (in percent)

ActualShotWeight.description: Specifies the value determined by the feeder as the shot weight

DeliveryPressureMeasuringPoint.description: Position of the pressure sensor used for the DeliveryPressure

DeliveryType.description: Indication if the dosing system works with delivery pressure or volumetric flow

DeviceMappingNumber.description: Unique identifier/address/number for devices of the same DeviceType within a local network

HighestActiveAlarmSeverity.description: Indication of the severity of the highest active alarm

MaterialBalanceSystemType.title: MaterialBalanceSystemTypeEnumeration
MaterialBalanceSystemType.description: Type of the material balance system

MaxDeviationMixingRatio.description: Used to limit the maximum deviation in percent

MixingRatioTarget.description: Target of the mixing ratio (includes ratio change when MaterialBalanceSystem is active)

PurgeCyclicIdleTime.description: Time until the next purge cycle starts

PurgeCyclicQuantity.description: Amount of material during a purge ccle as the sum of both components

PurgeMode.description: Depending on this preselected PurgeMode, various purge function can be activated via the dosing signal of the IMM

PurgeQuantity.description: Amount of material during the active purge mode

PurgeStatus.title: PurgeStatusEnumeration
PurgeStatus.description: Actual status of the purge function

PurgeTimeout.description: Maximum time of the active PurgeMode

RemainingMaterialTime.description: Remaining time until first material is empty

RemoteControlActivated.description: With this signal, the LDS signalizes, if it is ready to be controlled via this or a separate interface

SetShotWeight.description: Reference value determined by the IMM or defined by the user on the IMM side

SetValueCompositeDensity.description: The composite set point of density

TargetDeviationMixingRatio.description: This deviation (in percent) is set/used by the material balance system

data.description: With this variable the client selects the method of remote control
List of the active errors of the device

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

Comment.description: The comment to add to the condition.

EventId.description: The identifier for the event to comment.

SubscriptionId.description: The identifier for the subscription to refresh.
The identifier for the subscription to refresh.

MonitoredItemId.description: The identifier for the monitored item to refresh.

SetRampDown.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetRampUp.description: Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

data.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time
Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

ResetMonitoring.description: With this method the tolerance values are set according to the actual value and the set monitoring sensitivity

ActualValue.description: Actual value of the monitored parameter

AlarmSuppression.description: The start-up alarm suppression deactivates alarms of a monitored parameter during start up or a setpoint jump

AutomaticMonitoring.description: Determination if monitoring tolerance parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

LowerTolerance.description: Lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter

LowerTolerance2.description: Second lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter

MaxValue.description: Maximum absolute value of the process parameter

MinValue.description: Minimum absolute value of the process parameter

MonitoringSensitivity.description: Defines how closely the tolerances are set during the automatic limit setting

SetRampDown.description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetRampUp.description: Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

SetValue.description: Set/nominal/target value of the monitored parameter

Status.description: Information if the ActualValue is within the tolerances or has passed a tolerance or min/max value

UpperTolerance.description: Upper relative tolerance value of the process parameter

UpperTolerance2.description: Second upper relative tolerance value of the process parameter

AutoTuningOff.description: Stops an already active self-optimisation process (no control parameters are changed)

AutoTuningOn.description: Starts the self-optimisation of the controller

AutomaticControllerMode.description: Determination if PID Parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

AutoTuningActive.description: Informs if the automatic tuning is currently active

PIDParameters.description: PID Parameters as array if several input signals (sensors) are used for the control

items.title: PIDParametersDataType
items.description: Structure for storing the parameters of a PID controller

HelpText.description: Text with additional information for the operator

DeviceClass.description: Indicates in which domain or for what purpose a certain device is used

Manufacturer.description: Provides the name of the manufacturer of the machine

Model.description: Represents the name of the machine type

SerialNumber.description: Represents the serial number of the machine (unique ID given by the manufacturer)

YearOfConstruction.description: Represents the year of construction of the machine

GetCurrentPage.description: Method for retrieving a screenshot of the control system with the currently shown contents

GetPage.description: Method for retrieving the image of a page of the control system

SetMachineTime.description: Method for setting the server time together with TimeZoneOffset

LocationName.description: Description of the location of the machine given by the machine operator or OPC client

PageDirectory.description: List of the pages that are implemented in the machine control system and are shown on the screen of the machine

items.title: PageEntryDataType
items.description: Information on a page that is implemented in the machine control system and shown on the screen of the machine

TimeZoneOffset.title: TimeZoneDataType
TimeZoneOffset.description: Difference of the local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) given by the machine operator or OPC client

UserMachineName.description: Description of the machine given by the machine operator or OPC client

UIElement.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.

data.description: Stand-in for an unspecified data type.
